titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller University records, Director of Program Planning and Development
A Guide to the Rockefeller University records, Director of Program Planning and Development FA222

did.unittitle: Rockefeller University records, Director of Program Planning and Development

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Materials requiring specialized equipment for access (film, audio, video, slides) may be restricted from scholarly research dependent on availability of the applicable equipment.
Brittle or damaged items, or materials otherwise in need of preservation care, may be restricted from scholarly research at the discretion of the RAC Head of Archival Services/RAC Head of Reference.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: In April 1970, as a special assistant to the President, Rodney W. Nichols was appointed Director of Program Planning and Development. The program was created to develop directions of future programs of research and education and to assist in finding resources to fulfill those programs. In November 1971 Ray F. Carmichael was appointed as Director of Development at The University to assist the Board of Trustees Development Committee, chaired by C.W. Cook and to work with Mr. Nichols in long range planning.
In 1972 at a meeting on October 31 the University Trustees elected Rodney W. Nichols to the new post of vice-president for program planning and development.

In November 1973 Dr. Seitz announced two newly created positions. Robert L. Van Valer was named Director of Trust and Estate Gift plans, and George Smith was appointed assistant director for development.

September 19, 1974, Bruce L. Crisman was appointed Development Officer at The Rockefeller University. Mr. Crisman resigned April 1975 and was replaced in September by Barry W. Dress, formerly development administrator at Pace University.

January 25, 1977 announcement was made that David O. Smith was appointed to the Development Office, as director, capital resources. His initial responsibilities will be in the area of corporate funding.

In,1977 Mary Detwiler Smith was named coordinator of Development services with responsibility for donor relations and to assist in developing contacts with prospective donors among general welfare, personal and family foundations.
January 1978 Patrick J. Garvey was appointed director of corporate and foundation relations to replace David O. Smith who resigned.
Early in 1979 Ray F. Carmichael left the University to accept a post at the Sidney Farber Cancer Center in Boston.
In August 1979 Frederick G. Lehmann was appointed as Executive Director for Development and Public Affairs.

In July 1985 Barry Dress was appointed Vice President for University Relations (new post). Judith N. Schwartz was appointed Director of Public Information, succeeding Mr. Fulvio Bardossi who has retired. Mr. Marc S. Kaplan was appointed Public Information Officer. (See news release, 18 July 1985)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlet prepared for use in fund raising.
News releases regarding grants toward $118 million development effort.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for scholarly research.
